title: Suir Blueway Walking Route

nearby.description: Lough Mohra and Rath Beag Loop

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / The old bridge, Carrick on Suir, Co. Tipperary
images.caption: The old bridge, Carrick on Suir, Co. Tipperary. Over the river, Carrickbeg is in County Waterford.  Carrick-on-Suir is the home town of cyclists Sean Kelly and Sam Bennett, with many considering this area to be Ireland’s spiritual home of cycling.

images.title: John M / Grazing land beside the River Suir
images.caption: Grazing land beside the River Suir

images.title: Graham Horn / Poulakerry castle
images.caption: Poulakerry castle An Irish tower house. It was built in the 15th century on a location overlooking a potential crossing point of the River Suir, probably contemporary with Ballynornan castle about five miles further east.

images.title: John M / Motte beside the River Suir
images.caption: Motte beside the River Suir. Presented to the village by Lady Le Poer.

images.caption: River Suir near Ferryhouse. In spate and viewed looking downstream from Sir Thomas' Bridge.

images.title: Gashouse Bridge, Clonmel by Humphrey Bolton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gashouse Bridge, Clonmel

description: Enjoy a walk or cycle along the River Suir from Carrick-on-Suir to Clonmel on this lovely waterside route in County Tipperary. The Blueway/Greenway trail runs for just over 20km, passing along the flat riverside path. Along the way you will enjoy fine views of the countryside and the village of Kilsheelan. There's also picturesque old bridges, fine country homes and an historic castle to see on the route. You can continue along the blueway to visit the nearby Cahir Castle . The 12th century castle is well worth a visit with lovely grounds and a fascinating history. The section between Clonmel and Cahir is generally used by kayakers, paddle boarders and other water users.
